results.title: Koalas
results.creator_credit: John Shaw, John Morris and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australian wildlife”.
The Koala’s popular image is as a sleepy, little creature. This film captures him in a more frolicsome mood - running, swimming and climbing. Active or drowsy, however, the Koala is always a popular subject. Also attmpts to correct some of the misconceptions about koalas.

results.title: Platypus cove
results.creator_credit: Peter Maxwell, Geoffrey Gardiner and Independent Productions (AU)
results.brief_description: Jim Mason is a 15 year old street struggling to stay on the right side of the law. He lands a job on a tugboat from Platypus Cove and things seem to be looking up. His peace is shattered however when he becomes the number one suspect for a sabotage attempt on the boat. It’s up to Jim and his crew of friends to catch the real culprits in a race around Sydney harbour. No year of production available.

results.title: Platform = Zhan tai [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Jia Zhang-ke, Shozo Ichiyama, Li Kit Ming, Hu Tong Communications, Artcam International and T-Mark
results.brief_description: An insightful realistic portrayal of China in the 1980s beautifully presented by acclaimed Chinese director Jia Zhang-ke and supported by an equally superb cast in Wang Hong-wei (Minliang), Liang Jing-dong (Chang Jun), Yang Tian-yi (Zhong Pin) and Zhao Tao (Ruijuan). “Platform” is set in a time of tremendous political and socioeconomic change where pervasive western capitalist influences are beginning to impact on all aspects of Chinese life, family and values. Change is inevitable, even in the small rural town of Fenyang in Shanxi Province where the Fenyang Peasant Culture Group, a local performing arts troupe made up of teenagers face the choice of either maintaining their communal ways and propaganda performances or move into the new world of privatisation and pop culture. The story follows the paths of four young performers in this troupe, over a period of ten years from 1979 to 1989, exploring their friendships and relationships with each other, with family and with the rapidly changing political and social environment around them as they struggle, individually, and as part of the Culture Group, for identity. It is in this arena of identity that music plays such a crucial role. Laconic and slow-moving, sparse in narrative and set against a somewhat bleak background where the characters often appear aloof and distant, “Platform” manages to draw the audience in, aided not only by the rare inside look at Chinese history during a turbulent time, but also by some powerful and evocative sounds and images shot by innovative cinematographer Yu Lik Wai. (Awards: Venice; Buenos Aires; Singapore)

results.title: Plasmo
results.creator_credit: Anthony Lawrence, Tony Wright, Beyond International, Film Victoria and Plasmo Mega Studios
results.brief_description: Plasmo, Parsty and Nik Nik are stuck on the planet Pynco, desperate to return home, when they come across two explorers, Brucho and Coredor. This tape includes seven adventures previously screened on ABC television. Episodes include: PLASMO AND THE MOONTOWER, PLASMO BLASTS OFF, PLASMO IN DEEP SPACE, PLASMO ARRIVES, TOUR OF MONJOTROLDECLIPDOC, PLASMO AND THE SPACE GHOSTS, PLASMO AND THE BOOKWORM. The magic of puppetry and animation used to create Plasmo’s world will delight children everywhere. Voices provided by Abbe Holmes, Pia Morley and Phil Houghton.

results.title: Plas Newydd, Angelsey, Wales
results.brief_description: Plas Newydd, which means “new house”, is the country home of the Marquis of Angelsey, Wales. The film examines this stately home and the present Marquis of Angelsey discusses its history. Part of the series “A Place in Europe”.

results.title: Planning a city
results.brief_description: Sydney, the second greatest white city in the British Empire. A critical analysis of Sydney and the initial lack of city planning. Despite the surrounding beauty and the opportunity for wise planning, Sydney became a crowded and poorly serviced city. Many houses were built on narrow, cramped and dimly lit streets which contributed to the escalation of crime and disease. Those responsible for constructing roadways rarely considered the impact on residents. Many schools and shopping centres were built on major thoroughfares resulting in a high rate of school children and housewives being killed by cars. Considering the harbourside location, many of the views became obstructed by buildings housing the privileged. The ‘Town and Country Planning Act of 1945’ was introduced to provide an opportunity to remedy the mistakes of the past by planning for future improvements. This film includes scenes of Sydney as it was in the middle of this century and what is now historical footage of cars, buses, trams, trains, ferries and horse and carts.

results.title: Planes, trains and automobiles
results.brief_description: It’s Thanksgiving and Neal Page (Steve Martin) is looking forward to spending some quality time with the family. While on the flight home, Neal is seated next to obnoxious shower curtain ring salesman Del Griffith (John Candy). When a snow storm causes their plane to be rerouted, the two are reluctantly united by their misfortune. Thus begins a disastrous chain of events that transcends all forms of public transport and threatens to make Neal miss Thanksgiving all together.
